question: What is the differences between an Agency Manager account and an Agent account?
text:
What is the differences between an Agency Manager account and an Agent account?
          
        
The Virginia's Insurance Marketplace platform provides the producer community with two account options. These account options provide producers the flexibility they need to manage their book of business while also managing their agency.

The two accounts available are:

Agency/Agency Manager Account (for producers who work on their own or are a supervisor inside a larger agency).

and

Agent Account (for producers within an agency that do not supervise other agents).

Agency Manager Accounts Can:

Manage Agents within the agency

Add/Remove Agents within the agency

Manage the agencys clients

Transfer clients between agents as needed

Manage clients within the agency managers own book of business

Complete applications and Plan selections on a clients behalf

Accept or decline new clients

Add new clients



Agent Accounts Can:

Manage Clients

Complete applications and Plan selections on a clients behalf

Accept or decline new clients

Add new clients
